summary: This is an email from a Budget Analyst at the Federal Bureau of Prisons regarding a fund control update for a camera replacement project at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn, NY. The document shows administrative activity at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held prior to his death.

persons.name: Budget Analyst
persons.context: Sender of the email regarding a fund control update for camera replacement at the Metropolitan Detention Center.

events.title: Camera Replacement Fund Control Update
events.description: A Budget Analyst at the Federal Bureau of Prisons sends an email updating fund control for a camera replacement project at the Metropolitan Detention Center.

locations: Metropolitan Detention Center, 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: The email is dated August 14, 2019, which is two days after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (a different facility).
It concerns a $800,000 camera replacement project at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn.
The document is administrative and does not directly mention Jeffrey Epstein, his case, or any individuals involved with him.
The email originates from the Federal Bureau of Prisons, the agency responsible for the facility where Epstein died.
The timing of the request (two days post-Epstein's death) may be coincidental but places the document within the immediate aftermath of the incident.
